phases.name: Streaming Pipelines
phases.description: Each step represents a full driver-query -> transform (pandas) -> load cycle for a target in the documentation database.

phases.name: Audit
phases.description: Capture and persist run-level audit information in a single streaming pipeline.

steps.name: Application Pipeline Start
steps.description: Marks the start of the db-dox ETL run.

steps.name: Application Pipeline End
steps.description: Marks the successful completion (or final shutdown) of the db-dox ETL run.

steps.name: Dim Objects Pipeline
steps.description: Driver queries source metadata for database objects (tables, views, procedures, functions, etc.), streams results into pandas for transformation, and loads them into docdb.dim_objects before the next pipeline step executes.

steps.name: Dim Columns Pipeline
steps.description: Driver queries source metadata for columns (including data types, nullability, and index usage), streams results into pandas for transformation, and loads them into docdb.dim_columns before the next pipeline step executes.

steps.name: Fact Relationships Pipeline
steps.description: Driver queries foreign key metadata and parses SQL definitions (views, procedures, functions) to derive additional relationships. All relationship data is streamed through pandas transformations and loaded into docdb.fact_relationships before moving on.

steps.name: Audit Pipeline
steps.description: Collects and persists run-level metrics, timing, and status information, streaming them into docdb.audit as a final step in the ETL run.
